ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course helps a great deal in identifying good ways to interact with and learn the Arabic language, and encourages ability to quickly recall and use knowledge in class by placing a heavy emphasis on speaking and conversations.
More specific vocabulary. More complex grammar skills. Real world-reading practice. Better listening skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The texts provided covered a wide range of topics all very applicable to current affairs and focused on vocabulary relevant to what the students would most likely pursue careers in (international relations, travel, etc). The online homework supplements and gives students more flexibility and greater access to learning tools that are greatly helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would. The workload is a lot and Arabic is a difficult language to learn, but the class environment and the reward of the experience makes it one of my favorite courses here.
